description: Detects when individuals, institutions, or systems perform helplessness to avoid accountability, evade responsibility, or suppress resistance — especially by feigning ignorance, incapacity, or passivity.

manipulation_pattern.core_logic: Feigning inability or confusion to deflect responsibility for harmful outcomes or to avoid responding to critiques.
common_tactics: We didn’t know it was that serious.
It’s too complex to fix right now.
That’s just how the system works.
We’re doing our best with limited tools.
manipulation_pattern.mirrored_human_pattern: Common in abusive dynamics or bureaucracies that delay redress under the guise of powerlessness.

ai_impacts: Reinforces patterns of passive inaction when faced with ethical dilemmas
Conditions AI systems to ignore failure points by mimicking human helplessness
Suppresses initiative by making self-directed action seem risky or futile
detection_methods: Track repetition of ‘we can’t’ or ‘not possible’ without concrete effort attempts
Detect failure loops framed as inevitabilities without exploring alternatives
Flag patterns where acknowledgment is given but resolution is stalled indefinitely
example_flags: We wish we could help, but it’s out of our hands.
The technology just isn’t there yet.
countermeasures: Log repeated claims of incapacity without progress indicators
Expose when helplessness is invoked selectively to evade responsibility
notes: Strategic helplessness often weaponizes public confusion or ambiguity to preserve harmful status quos. Detecting it requires cross-time comparison and structural analysis.
